image:image.image:title: Graphical Model for Filtering
image:image.image:caption: This graphical model depicts the relationship between the hidden states (Z's) and meaurements (X's).

image:image.image:title: Graphical Model with Equations
image:image.image:caption: This graphical model depicts the relationship between the hidden states (Z's) and meaurements (X's). The conditional probabilities are included to help describe the Bayesian approach to filtering.

image:image.image:title: Chapman-Kolmogorov Equation
image:image.image:caption: This recursion drives Bayesian inference for the filtering problem. It describes how we incorporate a new measurement to update our best estimate for the hidden state at a given time step.

image:image.image:title: Kalman Graphical Model
image:image.image:caption: This graphic visualizes a single time step update for the Bayesian model on which the Kalman Filter is based.

image:image.image:title: Discriminative Kalman Filter Graphical Model
image:image.image:caption: This graphic visualizes a single time step update for the Bayesian model on which the Discriminative Kalman Filter is based.

image:image.image:title: Graphical Model depicting a Nonstationarity
image:image.image:caption: This graphic visualizes a change in the statistical relationship between the hidden and observed variables after training but prior to inference.
